intro: Lagenocarpus rigidus subsp. tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lagenocarpus, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying tropical flora.
